page.title: 15OLD HOUSES/SEWAGE/BIRDS/CARS
page.content: {HISTORICAL BUILDINGS}:- Danehurst- built 1827 by Frances Davies- now called St Raphaels is an old age pensioners home run by nuns. Tanyard Farm- built 1460 for shoe making. Chapelwood Manor- built by Joby Lungsford. Old Forge Cottage- built 1440, originally open hall house. Danehill Church- built 1891 as a monument to Mr Hardy from Danehurst. {SEWAGE}:-The sewage from all round the area is purified in Danehill and is then pumped into the Ouse. {BIRDS}-As 50% of the area is woodland, many different birds have their nests here. As well as the more common birds it harbours goldcrests, sparrow hawks & sand martins. {CARS}:-Most people own a small family car, which can be used for everyday things.
